one_review_text:
I bought and had this monitor for about a week as a second monitor to my iMac. That is part of the problem, it takes a REALLY good monitor to match the iMac screen, but this monitor was too dark even for a decent monitor. I was disappointed.
I know how to calibrate a monitor and I know about color profiles, but nothing came close to usable for a second screen.
I returned and bought an LG 32” 4K for the same price and it is much better.
If this is your only monitor and you don’t work a lot with digital photography or video, this is probably a good value.
I think it would be great for gamers because it has some cool features, like picture-in-picture end all sorts of fancy color and contrast options.
It just didn’t work for my color accuracy needs.
Great monitor for gaming and has HDR.  Will fully connect with Xbox one x only issue is Dolby vision sound and that’s due to no speakers. Great investment for gamers
Great monitor for gaming and has HDR.  Will fully connect with Xbox one x only issue is Dolby vision sound and that’s due to no speakers. Great investment for gamers
This monitor looks absolutely amazing when using either my desktop gaming computer or my Xbox One X. The 4K HDR is absolutely amazing on any game or video I watch.

I love my computer monitors the only issue I have and I guess it was my fault for not checking these darn things don't come equipped with speakers, other than that they are the best monitors I've owned. they have eye protection and I wondered about that. Until i used it, and wow its great on the eyes.

Vibrant and responsive monitor. Didn’t think 4K meant much until I plugged my computer into this monitor when I got it home. Decent price. Reliable. Happy with my purchase after a month of owning this.

you would like this monitor but only if you play with the setting to see what you like better do you want brighter visuals or visuals that will put less strain on your eyes. You will have to adjust it to your liking but it's easy to change and adjust.

My 12-year-old IPS panels were getting a little long in the tooth and one was showing signs of impending failure, so I picked up a pair of these at a very good price. Best Buy promised a quick delivery to their local store - despite the COVID-19 mess - and the rest is history.

I did experience a slight problem. One of the pair seemed a bit on the dim side and soon developed an intermittent vertical line of dead pixels a few inches from the left edge. Best Buy's awesome swap policy to the rescue! To my surprise and delight, they even had an extra in stock at the local store. Maybe they shipped an extra with my pair, y'know, just in case? Whatever, it was an easy, no-wait swap. The replacement took care of my issue.

So I've been using these for a little less than two months on a Windows 10 box driven by a GTX 1660 Super card with great success at 2840x2160, 60 Hz., RGB color format, 32-bits deep, 10 bpc, over Display Port. Use quality cables and watch the cable run to avoid close proximity to power supplies and other noise sources. They're very bright monitors, you'll definitely want to ratchet the brightness down from the default. Otherwise, the default settings are good right out of the box. No dead pixels (other than the line I mentioned earlier and remedied with a swap). I've recently stopped throwing up full-screen color rasters now and then to check, figuring that any new problems are just mine to work out with Samsung.

One thing I should mention - I'm NOT a gamer. Pretty much all productivity applications on my work-a-day desktop, so I can't say how these monitors would be for a performance-demanding gamer. However, I do a bit of video editing and processing and I haven't noticed any issues with image tearing or any other weirdnesses. I recognize that gaming can be demanding, though, and that can mean you need to spend more to get what you need. These monitors are VERY reasonably priced.

Overall, two thumbs up for me. These are nice IPS panels and I'd buy 'em again.Read more
Great sized monitor and very nice display.  Happy with my purchase!  Would purchase again.  Only thing I didn't consider when I bought it was whether it had a camera, and it does not.

Other monitors I looked at had controls on right, but not ideal for dual monitor setup. Note this has smaller 70mm vesa pattern. I had to modify my monitor arm mounts which has universal 70 or 100. I had purchased a larger 4K 32" Samsung monitor but the viewing angles were atrocious for color consistency.  I replaced it with two of these monitors and am very pleased with the results. I find the text easier to read in comparison even though it's a little smaller.

I'm not sure why some of the reviews are complaining about picture quality but it does take a little setup to get the picture looking good.  I had to: 
* switch the HDMI black level to Normal as it Low washed out some light gray colors
* enable HDR in Windows 10.  
* set the output color format to YCbCr444 in the nvidia control panel

I still have to fine tune calibrate the display but it looks like they did a calibration at the factory.

OK, when the monitor was awake and working the picture was excellent, colors good, resolution crisp.  However, everytime my MacBook would go to sleep the monitor would die and not wake up without unplugging it and powering it back up.  I've never had this problem with other monitors (HP, LG, and others) so, even though I generally like Samsung products, this one went back to Bestbuy after it happened several times over the course of a couple of days.  

Also, while it was in "dormant" mode, it was clear that the screen had definite areas where the pixels were darker than others even though I would have thought the display would have been consistent over the entire screen rather than patchy.

Finally, another reviewer mentioned the awkwardness of the controls and I have to echo that.  The joystick that turns it on and off and also gets you to the options is awkward both in location and operation.

one_review_title: Best Buy was fine but the product was not.
one_review_text: I bought this monitor to connect to my (retina) MacBook Pro as my desktop monitor. On the one hand, the monitor was brilliant: great picture, tons of resolution. However, after my MacBook went to sleep, whenever I awakened the system by hitting some keys on the keyboard, the screen had an annoying pink background. The only way to eliminate the problem was to force the HDMI to re-connect, by raising the laptop screen or disconnecting the HDMI cable and re-connecting. I have had other HDMI monitors that did not have this problem. It's a problem with all of these monitors and, I suspect, with any monitor that uses the same HDMI chip. For the money, I thought it should work correctly. I returned this item and found another (LG) HDMI monitor that did not have this problem. I should mention that Best Buy was helpful throughout.

Best 4K IPS hdr10 monitor it's probably the only monitor I'm ever going to own even though it only has 60 hertz, I'm okay with that cause I'm on console and on my pc 60 is fine for me as well. The only complaint that I have is the stand is stationary you cannot solve all around the screen so I just have to like tilted up other than that the picture is crystal clear it even makes my games on my PS4 Pro look a heck of a lot better

Please avoid, my first unit went haywire with the screen glitching out and constantly turning off. Thinking I got a bad apple I returned it and tried again and within a few days the same problem arose to the point it wouldn’t turn on. I confirmed that all input devices were working ok. Don’t waste your time on this piece of junk. Even when it worked the picture quality was meh. Pick another brand such as LG. Save yourself the hassle.
Picked up as a second monitor for a graphic designer. Works well

one_review_title: Stunning Monitor, will never go back...
one_review_text:
I really struggled trying to decide if I should go with multiple 1440p or 4K. I mostly do programming/coding and I read a lot of text. Sometimes I play games too. I decided to go 4K for the crisp text, and I'm so glad I did. Wow, It's amazing. This monitor is everything I could want. Great viewing angles, razer sharp text, nice and bright, and plenty of settings to adjust the picture for viewing comfort. I highly recommend this monitor. I wish I had it a year ago.

The only drawbacks are not related to the monitor at all:

1) The included HDMI cable is short and unreliable. I got occasional signal drops. Also if you have an NVIDIA video card, Freesync (G-SYNC compatibility mode) does not work over HDMI. Plan on buying a high quality Displayport cable that is not included, and when shopping for a Displayport cable google "pin 20 displayport issue" and make sure you get a cable that does not have this problem.
2) Windows high-dpi scaling is still a poor experience. Especially with this monitor size at 4K, the most "comfortable" scaling level is about 125%, some apps are not optimized for this and prefer 150%. You will need to get familiar with windows per-application display scaling if you decide to go with a 4K monitor in 2020. I hope windows applications improve high dpi support in the future.Read more

The panel its self is very good, Color accuracy is pretty good, lighting is very good. Over all a very good 4k panel for the price. The stand however has no height adjust, and is near fully static. I strongly recommend getting a monitor arm with this monitor.

The magicbright function didn't work at all.  Samsung support tried to tell me that it wasn't offered on this model even though their product page said it was.  The brightness just wasn't enough without it.  I ended up returning it for a different brand.

one_review_title: Great picture, horrible auto input switch
one_review_text: This review is specifically for the button functionality at the bottom of the monitor and the “auto” input switch. My main issue is the monitor doesn’t automatically switch between the two separate devices I have plugged in through each of the HDMI slots. If my PC is off, and I turn it on, it does not automatically switch from the PS4 HDMI 2, to HDMI 1, even though the setting is set to auto. While waiting for it to switch, the button at the bottom is absolutely useless as it will maybe sometimes respond. I usually end up turning the monitor off completely, and then when turned back on, the button will respond and bring up the menu which will MAYBE trigger the input to switch. It’s sad that a $80 ASUS monitor does this flawlessly but not this overpriced piece of garbage.
I returned an item, and it is more than two weeks, I haven’t here any response. Take a long time for return process =((
I was not aware monitors do not have speakers. Only audio port for headphones.

one_review_text: Bought two of these to upgrade my home office. Professional grade monitors at a good price for me (less than $400 at the time). Haven't fully tested its UHD (4K) capabilities but I am in a graphic heavy field and have noticed that the screen can handle very high resolution images.

I ended up switching to a different brand and it works great!

So crisp and clear... and the resolution is amazing.  The beauty of 4K/UHD is at a great price/value here.  I've been a lift long supporter of a different brand and I went outside of my comfort zone with this Samsung... and I'm not disappointed at all! This monitor flashes way too much. The whole screen will just turn back occasionally.  If this problem persists, I will have to come in and get another one
Great for normal computers. Not to fond of it for gaming setup. Sorry!

one_review_title: Great monitor at this price point
one_review_text:
Purchased for work due to working at home now and wanting more desktop space on a single screen. I'm used to Dell Ultrasharp monitors for editing, and this was a very reasonable compromise for what I would consider a budget 4K monitor. 
Color is on the cool side (blue) and default color profiles are pretty contrasty. A few color correction attempts and it's close enough for work. Not perfect, I'll admit, but at nearly half the cost of other 4k photo editing monitors this is certainly good enough to get you nearly there. 
The multiple ports work well having to computers plugged in (work machine and personal machine). But the single menu/power/toggle button setup can be temperamental when trying to switch inputs. Sometimes it doesn't "see" the other input signal when you ask it to switch inputs. 
Thin, lightweight, and doesn't put out much heat at all. Screen tilts, but does not raise or lower. So you might want a stand for it depending on your desk/table. 
For all the positives, and the price, five stars.Read more
Samsung 28" monitor with 4k uhd is reasonable priced with decent picture quality. The only draw back is the stand, looks cheap.  Overall I'm satisfied
I want to return this product. It took my minimac to recognize it forever. Then I tried with my windows computer and same thing. Do not buy this. Oh it has no speakers

I needed to upgrade my monitors to add additional video inputs, so switched from 1920x1080 to this 4K UHD monitor. I wanted something that would let me replace two monitors with one large one, or to be able to use windows 10 snap features to still effectively have two monitors for applications to maximize to. This works very well. I set the scaling to 100% (small fonts!) and now have the equivalent of four desktops 2x2, or one very large one depending on how I tile the apps. Extremely versatile. Picture is clear, no flickering. I use a HDMI v2 cable with a GTX 1060 6GB card with a Core I5 processor. and it works fine. I can now also use with my dell laptop - though I only get 3864x2160@30hz from that hdmi port on the laptop, but that's fine for what I'm doing.

Working on photos in 4K mode using lightroom and photoshop is nice. I miss the second monitor for loupe/grid/compare/survey modes, but it's easy enough to use the floating '2nd' window, or to tile to quarters still. Having the extra resolution is amazing. A whole new view of photos and no zooming in/out. The size of the monitor makes for a nice photo display .
Watching 4K video on amazon prime is amazing too. I've also rehooked my speakers to the monitor headphone output - so I can now send audio via the hdmi cables to the monitor to speakers - so I don't have to reconnect speakers to switch between my laptop/desk top/firetv etc.  Very convenient.

Menu is very simple, and easy to use. Mute/volume controls on the monitor are convenient. Cables are a little fiddle to install on the back, but that's a small detail. 

I did have to do a little tweak with the colors using my idisplay pro just to get a slightly better color matchin, but it wasn't far off, and it has fully automated adc controls, or you can adjust manually. 
The only thing that hasn't been very stable - using PiP. While it works, I found that more often than not when I switch between the pip modes, my desktop /gtx1060 video would mess up and I'd wind up not being able to see the display of my desktop and I ended up forcing hte pc to reboot blindly to recover it. Seems to be an issue with the pip / Edid management confusing the desktop graphics card/driver.  I've seen others report similar issues. Right now I am avoiding using PiP, but switching between sources works reliably , which is what I'm really after.Read more

I just love the quality of Samsung products.  Most importantly their warranty.  I had one of my 24” go bad after 3.5 years of long term usage and was paid current retail value of the monitor.  I used the funds to purchase the 28”.  I went from 24” curved to 28” 4K IPS for home/work use.  Great picture quailty.  Movies run flawless (though I have a gaming video card) with the 60hz refresh rate.  4K movies are stunning.  Only gripe is that the blacks are too black,  dark scenes are very near total black and looks like I only hear sound.  Perhaps I need to play with the video settings.  However,  I’m not watching movies regularly on a 28” monitor so I really don’t care.

one_review_title: Excellent UHD Monitor at Price Point
one_review_text: After much time browsing online for a new monitor, my search suddenly showed this model available at my local store. With no prior reviews, and no unit on display at the store, I made the risky decision to purchase it anyway. Boy, was I glad i did. This monitor is superb. Color levels are very accurate, picture is clear and sharp, and brightness is more than adequate. I run it around 65% brightness, which is just right. I was considering the LG 27UL600, which has excellent reviews, but it didn't support HDR 10 like this one does. Like I said, it was risky choosing this monitor because there's really no reviews anywhere on the internet for it. Great purchase though, I would definitely but it again.

This Monitor has performed extremely well especially for the price!! The colors are very vivid and being a professional photographer and videographer it’s enhanced my capabilities tremendously. The HDR features are spot on and hoping these last with time will most definitely update you as I use the monitors vigorously throughout the year as I am always editing.
Monitor is so basic, it does not have controls for Brightness, Contrast, etc... so I returned it.

one_review_title: Great resolution that is easy on the eyes.
one_review_text: I really like the clarity of the picture on this monitor.  I plugged it into my HP laptop computer, and it gives me much more screen real estate for editing video files.  The screen has a tilt adjustment, but it does not have a height adjustment.  For my setup, this is not a problem, as I have a two-level desk, but other users may find that they need to put it on some kind of stand.  Overall I am quite satisfied with this monitor.

I've been using it with a MacBook Air and it gives a nice 4k picture when I want one. The MacBook Air has no trouble driving it, using a USB-C to HDMI adaptor. 

The base has a very wide footprint, almost as wide as the monitor itself. So that's something that might matter to people but I don't have an issue with it. The monitor tilts, but does not raise or lower in hight. 

I like using the single button/joystick on the bottom rather than 4 or 5 buttons found on other monitors. Especially ones that are not labeled well anyway.

Overall I'm happy with the purchase.

Overall, no complaints. I didn't see this monitor in store before purchasing it, but I'm happy with how it looks after I set it up at home. This is my first 4K monitor, so I may be easily pleased.

Color:
The color of this screen is nice, and it's less blue than my ASUS monitors at work. The color representation seems to be fairly accurate, which can be rare for anything non-Apple.

Size:
I was worried about the 28" size being too large, but I only have one monitor at home so the size was actually perfect. Anything larger wouldn't have fit on my desk.
Price:
It's little pricey, so I'd definitely recommend waiting for a sale.

Screen:
The screen doesn't light up all the way to the edge, and there's probably a 1/4 inch of blackness all around. Don't be fooled by the thin bezels.Read more

one_review_title: Great value for an evolutionary improvement
one_review_text: I'd been waiting for the 4K UHD monitors to become less expensive while still offering a good visual improvement. This monitor hits the sweet spot of price and quality. Didn't just buy one, bought THREE, including one for my office in the big city.

Much larger than I thought because I over-estimated my work monitor size.  Love the size though, quality is better with DP vs HDMI.  Wish there was a DP output so daisy-chain can be utilized.  Has jack for speakers, which are essentially useless since I connect to my device directly.  Has "eye-saving mode" which dims and warms the screen.

I've only used this monitor for not even a week yet, but I'm already regretting that I didn't replace my old monitor with something like this a long time ago. 

If you are into things like photography or CAD, where detail and color are important, this is a great monitor to consider. The size is just right. It doesn't force me to turn my head to see all parts of it. It is easier on my eyes.

The detail is insane. To my eyes, everything looks like a printed page with sharp details, clarity, and colors that I was used to seeing more muted. As an amateur photographer it is both a blessing and a curse: the curse is now I'm reviewing my old work and being chagrined to discover I didn't always get the focus tack sharp.
I'm using it with a classic 2010 Mac Pro (the cheese grater). I updated the graphics card to an RX 580 so I could take advantage of this monitor. Everything works great.

Now I just want to travel back in time a couple of years and slap myself. Then I want to tell myself to buy a 4K monitor. Then thank myself later.Read more
I fought and fought with it. I had to return my new mac and get a new one. Turns out, this monitor will just block the singla and stop receiving video. Complete garbage. DO NOT BUY if you own a mac.

I’ll admit I was a little iffy on spending so much on a monitor but, after unboxing and setting it up, I’m in love. The monitor is crisp, well lit and showcases 4K content perfectly. The only gripe I have would be that, While the instructions say it can tilt, I find it incredibly irritating to do so. Like I’m afraid I’ll put too much pressure on it and break the screen. 

If you’re a gamer and are looking for a good monitor, this is a great choice!

one_review_title: Not happy with monitor at all
one_review_text: The icons are tiny, it is difficult to adjust setting, the picture quality it advertised is nothing like promised. Makes playing games very difficult
I bought this monitor today but I cannot use it as it is missing half of its stand. How can best buy say a product is in fair condition if it is missing an important component like that.

I love my new monitor and I'm so happy with the purchase. The quality of the display is absolutely beautiful and the colors are nice and crisp while maintaining brightness and hues at the same time. I would highly recommend this monitor to anyone looking for an upgrade.

JUST GET IT. It won’t hurt you or your wallet. I’ve been in the market for a quality iOS display like this one and it did not disappoint. The image quality and color accuracy is second to none. Truly spectacular!

I wanted to get a larger screen to use with my laptop. The 4K screen has an excellent picture quality. The larger screen makes it so much easier to use with the Excel spreadsheets I am often working with. This is an excellent addition to my home office.

Was looking for a couple of new monitors for my computer and specifically my Xbox One X that would work well with the Series X out later this year and for the price, buying 2 of these fit the bill perfectly. Yes, the new systems can run 4K/120, but they are not going to run both 4K and 120 for any graphically intensive AAA games so 4K 60Hz will be enough.

The overall design is very sturdy and the modern look is great on my desk. The bezels are fairly minimal so that is another nice plus.

When it comes to the actual picture it is truly what I was expecting from 4K and though many will argue that the HDR is useless at this brightness level it may be, but the jump from 1080 to 4K is immense. Others will also argue that 60Hz is not enough, but unless you`re a professional player where your income is based on your play why you would subject yourself to 1440 or even 1080 versus 4K is beyond me and in my opinion, you are not using the full potential of your gaming system.
The only downside that others have also mentioned is the automatic switching of inputs between console and PC when I turn my Xbox off/on, but in reality, this is just nitpicking as it takes 2 seconds to change the input manually.

Overall, I can`t recommend this monitor enough as I had narrowed my decision down to this and the LG 27UL600 and after receiving this monitor and using it extensively I don`t have any regrets.Read more

one_review_title: Perfect WFH Monitor for Detailed Screen Time
one_review_text: After spending a few months working from home on my laptop, I was experiencing eye strain and decided to upgrade my home office with a bigger monitor. The graphics on the Samsung UR55 have been fantastic; the 4k resolution really does make a difference. Highly recommend if you are looking at an extended WFH scenario too.

I'm happy with the color quality of this monitor, which is the most important thing to me. The button control is also easy to use. However, there are a few things that could be improved.

First, there's a slight vignette in the corners so the backlighting could be better. It doesn't bother me that much on a day-to-day basis but it's apparent if you pay attention to it.

Second, I sometimes get burn-in on the screen if I've had the same thing up on the display for a while and switch to a more neutral flat image. It was really alarming at first but it goes away after several minutes. I don't know if it can be burned in permanently but I try to be mindful and use a screen saver.
Last, the design of the VESA mount in the back is pretty dumb because it only allows 75mm mounts, not 75/100 combo mounts. There seems to be not real design reason for doing this except for looks, which doesn't make sense because it's the back of the monitor, not the front.

Overall, the monitor is good for the price. The resolution and sharpness are good but I wish I had gone with a larger monitor for unscaled 4K resolution because text is a bit too small to read comfortably.Read more

This monitor is amazing! It delivers great 4K and HDR. The colors are great and  the monitor is Just a best when it comes to gaming. Everyday work flow using this is awesome. It has tons of real estate for multitasking. Most definitely recommend.

I went in to purchase this monitor but hesitated when I saw it next to other 32” monitors and the Ultra Wide monitors. I’m so glad I went with this one. 28” is perfect for my home office. The 4K HDR 60 HZ is beautiful. The edges around the screen are super slim with the bottom edge being thin and sleek brushed metal look. I used to work with (2) 27” HP 27er monitors at my last office. And this Samsung panel reminds me of one of those BUT feels much bigger, wider, and of higher Screen and build quality. Ultimately I didn’t go with the ultra wide because you’re pretty much limited to 1080p (or 2k if you spend twice as much) but with all my phone pictures and videos now recording in 4K, I’d rather have that level of pixel density in editing one day. Plus have the ability to watch 4K videos from online streaming if I feel like it. 
Get this monitor you won’t be sorry.
Bought this monitor for work and my Xbox and the picture quality is amazing and overall quality. Use it for both and love it so far no issues.
Great monitor good price!!!! I us this Monitor for video production and photo editing and it’s great! serves the purpose perfectly, 4K resolution is great and has great colors

My company reimbursed me for this purchase, and I picked this monitor only because it has the earliest delivery date. I was pleasantly surprised by how good the 4K IPS display is when I paired it with my Macbook Pro at work - the brightness, color quality and contrast are excellent.

Other than it being a Samsung, the design and picture quality is great. Price isn’t too bad!!

No VGA connector though if you’re looking for one with.

one_review_title: Beautiful panel! Overall, Issues at first..
one_review_text:
I gotta say first and foremost, I had some slight issues and debating if I wanted to return this panel or not.. I had a slight IPS faint hallowing bleed going on with my unit.. but in the end it wasn't as bad as I was making it out to be, and decided against the return. I was able to get 10 bit+HDR+4k to work on display port.. HDMI is limited via bandwidth to 4k+HDR+8bit. Overall I love the panel, beautiful accurate coolers and everything just POPS! I would definitely buy again.. I will be pairing this with PS5 in the fall, so all should be well in the neighborhood.

The VESA setup on this panel is also pretty odd, I luckily has a second mount on hand to fully take advantage, but make sure your 75x75 mount is rounded off on the edges.. because anything else is near impossible to get a decent fit.. Seems like a Samsung oversight for sure... 

I would take the chance for any potential buyers. Can't complain for this price point really.

one_review_title: Great 4K companion to my new MacBook Pro.

I use this with a dock as my primary monitor for my MacBook Pro. The 4K resolution and Vivid Samsung colors make both work and play more enjoyable.

one_review_title: Great Picture and Colors, HORRIBLE Bleed
one_review_text: The clarity and colors on this monitor are incredible. Truly vivid. But the backlight bleed along the edges was just too much to bear, even with the brightness at zero. I know this is an inexpensive monitor for its features, but any content with dark elements on the screen were ruined by the bleed. Since there aren’t any stores open near me, I’m just gonna get a refund instead of trying for another one of these. Other reviews have had similar issues to mine and I don’t want to take that chance.

I purchased 2 of these monitors to setup in home office without seeing on store display.  Great screen and color.  I rarely take a risk and this time it has not disappointed.  The screen is large, but proper placement in your setup will offset that.  I would recommend.

I had an HD monitor and was missing my wife screen monitors from the office.
With this one I no longer miss them. Great resolution, love it for coding, makes a huge difference.

I don’t love the mounting area, the recession does complicate mounting in a 100x100 base, especially one that sits close to the wall.

one_review_title: Nice panel but case and input design lacking
one_review_text:
Really nice colors and brightness on the underlying UHD IPD panel. Tons of depth and saturation, and the refresh rate is also nice. However the installation and usability are very subpar. 
-75x75 vesa mount. Also the mounting area is small, so if you have a universal mount with both 75x75 and 100x100 it most likely won’t fit into the slotted area 
-The cable connections inputs are very tight, and if you use quality braided cables they have to go in with a disconcertingly sharp angle. Also the angle of the cable input might cause damage later down the line if you have to constantly connect and reconnect
-Multi toggle system menu is not intuitive, and screen has finicky on off and sleep functionality. Sometimes the panel had to be hard turned off (unplugging/replugging of cables) which is problematic given the above issue
-constant loss of signal 

 With the use and functionality issues above maybe I just got a lemon, but the design features are impossible to overlook. 

That being said bestbuy was fantastic. Order delivered quicker than estimated and hassle free return. So 1.5 stars for the panel, 5 stars for Best Buy averages out to roughly 3 overallRead more
This was the perfect screen for my home office! I’m looking at getting another one! The clarity and color is amazing!

one_review_title: Great alternative to dual monitor setup
one_review_text: The display is perfect for a graphic design setup. The size and resolution make it possible to operate like a dual monitor workflow with the ability to go full screen when you want and not have the resolution detract from work at close range. The price is good for the quality and we've never had any complaints about a Samsung display.

Very high resolution compared to any prior monitor I have owned.  The size is sufficient to have two full page word documents displayed side-by-side, where a prior 24 inch monitor wasn't sufficient.  Has worked well with my laptop as an external monitor.

Only limitations in the world of Zoom, is that the monitor does not include speakers or a camera.  These weren't necessary features for me.
Great monitor for the price. Picture is clean and crisp even at the highest resolution.

I got this for my wife who does graphic and web design now working from home. It’s great with clarity on the screen for those small adjustments needing to be made. Setup was fairly simple. The stand kind of stuck the first time I tried adjusting the tilt on the screen but after that it works fine. Very stable setup.

Its a great option for a designer not looking to get a thunderbolt display. Though it doesn’t have built-in speakers, the resolution and IPS display are close of a thunderbolt display, it takes just time to dial in the settings.

I personally like the joystick button to scroll through, and unlike other reviews, it works fine. They might just have fatter fingers than me (i’m a pretty hefty dude.) or just jamming it.

I have been looking for a 4k Monitor with HDR and Freesync features for a decent price and I finally found it. Its only been out for a few months so it wasn't quite known yet. I use it with my xbox one x to get the true 4k experience and get myself ready for the xbox series x. The picture quality is definitely amazing and theres no stutter in game play, worth buying.

The display is not bad if you just need it for simple document editing, but it definitely struggles with colors - my screen consistently gave me a yellow tint despite playing with all color settings on the monitor and my Mac OS. Another monitor at a similar price point had no trouble with colors.

After purchasing this monitor, I was surprised to learn that it had no VGA port, but HDMI. I had planned to use a VGA-to-Display Port adapter, but the use of HDMI made that unnecessary. The size and resolution of the desktop makes it easy to see everything a school-aged child needs to see when attending virtual classes.

Stuck at home, I needed a bigger monitor for my MacBook Pro 13". This gives me the ability to look at two full sized pages side by side, or run a Zoom call will also reviewing the agenda and meeting documents.  It is easy to set up, and has a joystick button that does everything.  I was skeptical about the latter but it works.  Came with an HDMI cable, but alas MacBooks need a USB-C cable or a dongle so I am used a USB-C to DisplayPort cable to maximize resolution.  Games look good too.

This is probably the best gaming monitor I have ever owned. The image quality is spectacular. Even my games that do not run at 4k seem to look 2x better with the right settings applied on the monitor.
Fairly Sharp display, but colors just aren't up to true HDR. The screen on my two-year-old Dell 4K laptop has much deeper and vivid colors than this monitor.

This monitor is very large and the quality very high. As someone mostly using it for work and video viewing it does a fantastic job of displaying the picture clearly and allowing my to spreadsheet successfully. My only critique would be that it doesn’t have built in speakers.

Bought for the home office.  Ultra sharp, like reading text printed on high quality paper from a professional printer.  Non reflective screen is really nice and the colors really pop.  Plenty of contrast for office work. It does tilt though not very much.  28" is pretty good size but not too big.

To me the IPS is a bonus since it doesn't wash out like my old TN panel which was not good at all anywhere off center.  

The VESA pattern for mounting is 75.  However a 75/100 dual use mounting plate might too big and/or require you bend the corners as where you mount on the back is recessed at the top.  

I can't imagine anyone being unhappy with this monitor unless you need a faster refresh rate than 60hz.

I tried 27"+ several monitors and ended up this one, then bought 2 of them for my house since we are all WFH, great monitor with fast response and clear picture, look good too with thin edge. A 2nd note: Microsoft Surface Dock doesn't work well with the TN-type monitors I tried before this IPS-type one. My only problem is, it won't sleep while connected with Surface Dock, guess it's the dock issue...

perfect for media consumption and 4K/1440P 60fps gaming. I'm not a competitive gamer so this is just perfect for my needs. The colors are warmer than what I'm used to and in my opinion setting the color temperature to cool made the image quality worse on this monitor. that being said, every game/video on this pops and looks great!

I purchased this monitor for video editing and I very glad I went with this display. The two HDMI’s come in handy since I like to game on this with my PS4 too. But if you’re expecting not to use headphones I would tell you to buy some speakers as well, since this monitor does not have speakers.

one_review_title: A real stand out from Samsung
one_review_text: I really put the time in and did my homework because I needed 2 monitors for seamless monitor to monitor Efficiency for my office. I narrowed it down to 2 and I went with the Samsung and I'm glad I did. The colors are rich and vibrant and it seems to me to be a true 4K. The incredible design of the of the edges  Are narrow enough to  Give a  Seamless viewing for a to monitor system... I am very selective when I and choosing something that I need to be fantastic... I spend a measurable amount of my day with this and I highly recommend it

I'm using this monitor for my Xbox one s and the graphics look amazing in it. 4k 60 fps is the sweet spot for console gaming right now. I also use it for my PC to do work and watch videos. The picture quality is amazing. The color is a little saturated with red tones but still very colorful and sharp

one_review_title: From laptop to PS4 this thing is awesome!
one_review_text:
I use an estimating software that uses something like 8 pt font in the software.  I can change the font size of what I print but not in the program itself. That meant changing glasses after 2 hours and can't read anymore after another 3. This monitor makes the font size twice as big.  SOOO MUCH EASIER!!  
The picture is so clear and crisp when I hook up my PS4 pro.  The colors are amazing.

one_review_title: Easy side screen hookup to an IMAC
one_review_text: I ordered a USB adapter from my IMAC to HDMI and an HDMI cable plugged it all in and instantly I had a side screen for my IMAC.  Good clear picture and simple to hook up.

This was a Father’s Day gift for my husband. He picked it out. The monitor stand was easy to assemble. We had the adapter cable needed to connect the HDMI cord to his Macbook Air.

Picture is amazing! Brilliant colors. Clean and crisp. Even excel files and word docs look great. 

He uses it daily.
Exceptional clarity to this screen. Setup was a breeze and I continue to be 'distracted' by the quality of the picture. Hoping it's a very long time before I start looking past it.
Really high resolution, higher pixel density then other monitors at same price point.  Also bright, just adjust it as the default is on a darker standard setting.

The colors are vibrant and the image is so clear.  MLB 20 The Show looks unbelievable compared to playing it on my TV.  I'm loving this monitor for gaming and recommend it to anyone.  Freesync works on it also with Xbox one x.  The monitor comes with a high speed HDMI so freesync works flawlessly with xbox (xbox one x also comes with highspeed hdmi so you can just use that cable to connect to the monitor to get freesync.

I've been using this whilst working from home. I got it as an upgrade from a slightly smaller monitor. I've always liked the pictures on Samsung TVs (I have two) and this monitor definitely hasn't let me down. The colors are vibrant and the picture is nice and clear. I also like how the bezel is pretty minimal. I would absolutely buy this again.
Really digging the image quality. It packs a little more saturation and contrast than my LG 27 UHD IPS thats 3 years old. Stand isn't adjustable but that comes I guess with the price point.

one_review_title: Works great. I bought a second one.
one_review_text: Great picture being 4K.  I use dual screens for working from home.  When I use them personal use one is used with a Surface and the other a Raspberry Pi.  Love having multiple inputs.  So with 2 monitors. I could hook up 6 different devices.

one_review_title: Just pure awesomeness for the price
one_review_text: Once you go Samsung 4K, there ain’t going back to anything else. You need to use the DisplayPort for the full 60hz functionality. Even at 30hz, the 4K holds up really really really well.

The bottom "joystick" menu navigator is fairly easy to figure out, the picture quality is great... and I have 2 of them for my home office now giving me plenty of screen space to do development work, email, slack, etc

I previously ordered a Dell monitor that I just was not happy with so I ended up returning it. I picked up this monitor hoping that it would not let me down in terms of the picture quality and I can now say that this monitor is amazing! Only con that I can think of is the annoying monitor stand.
this display is amazing not much for gaming but watching videos was great crystal clear
Use this for my Xbox One X and gaming is crisp and clean.  Would recommend for 4K 60Hz gaming.
These monitors work great in my 2x2 monitor wall setup.  The screens are clear, do not generate heat, and are easy to look at for hours without any issue.
Great images, has PIP which is great. bit pricey for what it is but overall happy with it so far.
I love the image quality and design. Value is good for the money for the money spent
Excellent color and crisp graphics.  The monitor was super easy to set up
Using it as s second monitor . Very good clarity and color. Easy set up. Only issue is a red LED is on when there is power to the monitor. Kind of a problem

The display is good. The complains I have are following: 
1. The height of the display is not adjustable, which makes it hard to use. 
2. There is only one button to adjust brightness etc, so not easy to use.

one_review_title: Looks amazing on the xbox one X
one_review_text: Looks amazing, exactly what I wanted. Picture in 4k looks great and the response time on it is amazing.

I love this monitor overall but doesn’t have any physical adjustment. I ended up giving it away to my sister because the footprint of the monitor was just too big for my tiny work desk. She likes it and uses it every day working from home. It’s a good monitor if you have the space for it. I do like the large and brilliant picture.

I was skeptical when looking at this monitor because it’s fairly new and has limited reviews available. However, the monitor has far exceeded my expectations and offers great value/features for the price, especially the 4K quality.
Very nice picture clarity, able to split screen for multiple devices.
Great colors and view large screen good price for this monitor
After setting up the monitor and connecting the recommended cables, the UHD quality was Great.
I own this since a couple of months and it meets all my requirements. Display is crisp and clear. I mostly use it for work and tried gaming over stadia for few days and had no issues.

I got three of these and wished I would have choosen a different one. 
Height is NOT adjustable, it only tilts. It is VESA mountable if u don’t care about stands and want to use monitor arms or wall mount instead.
It has only 60hz!!! Even in low resolutions, you only get 60hz out of it.
It allows for HDMI and DisplayPort. It comes with an HDMI cable. You can connect both ports at the same time and use a split screen or pip.
The power supply is not a standard connector for three prongs, which is not ideal in my opinion, it is a round connector like you have for most laptops.
It supports FreeSync (AMD) graphic cards, it doesn’t support G-Sync (Nvidia cards).
It has a matte screen which I prefer over shiny screens, since they are easier on the eyes.
It is good for regular work, it is certainly not for gaming as it maxes out at 60hz at any resolution.
My recommendation, if you want a 4k without squeezing your eyes to much, look for a monitor of at least 32”.
4k on a 28” is pretty small. It seems ok at 125% magnification but kinda defeats having a 4k
Have had no issues so far.  Picture quality is as expected.

one_review_title: Great monitor for Price and features
one_review_text: This is probably the only Monitor I could find that had VSYNC / IPS / HDR / and <4MS response time while be affordable in price. Really great colors but took some time to adjust it. I run at 60FPS when playing any game with no ghosting.
Excellent Monitor for the price, 4K and very well made.
Amazing resolution! I specifically like the square set of screw ins for hooking up the screen to a monitor arm.

one_review_title: Great monitor if you looking for 4K
one_review_text: got this from on sale, cheapest price tag if you are looking for 4K monitor. the only thing it does not come with speaker. it will be great if Samsung make some 4K monitor with speaker.

one_review_title: Solid screen for the right price
one_review_text: A great screen for gaming and work. It was much bigger than expected. Please not there are not any built in speakers.
UHD screen resolution combined with the 28" size is perfect for working from home.  It's a solid replacement for the dual monitor setup that I have in the office.
This monitor has replaced an older 1080 resolution monitor. What an upgrade, I should not have waited so long. Great color and resolution I am very happy with it.
Attached this to CalDigit docking station that connected to HP Spectre 360 13 inch.  Finally can see 4K.  Unfortunately, it only has Display Port and no HDMI, but still works well.
Great quality and affordable price, the picture is astonishing, very elegant looking on my desk, too bad it doesn’t come with speaker but at least it comes with a headphone jack
I love this than LG 4K one. I have 4K LG that has some kind of light burn in issue. it remain light shadow after long time use and gone about minute later, but Samsung panel works better than LG.
Great picture. Perfect size for work at home. More than I wanted to spend, but well worth it.

This new monitor has exceeded all my expectations. I realized that 4K resolution was going to be better - but I had no idea how much difference it was going to make in my everyday workflow. When I'm not actually working (ha ha), I sometimes watch YouTube videos and the definition is remarkable. Why, I can count the whiskers on those funny kittens rolling around on the kitchen floor! I can see the sweat pouring off the faces of the flash mob dancers in Milan! I can see the dirt in the bear's fur as those guys try to pry the bucket off his head. Simply great resolution. Oh, it's also easy to set up and the controls are easy to understand. I couldn't be happier with my new Samsung monitor.
Great monitor for work and for playing.  Very vivid, great colors and easy setup.

I bought this monitor to WFH (I'm a teacher). I was using an older TV as a monitor for a few months and was getting headaches because the text would be slightly blurry. I decided to splurge on a nicer monitor, but I didn't want to purchase something that was 800 dollars. This is the best purchase of quarantine for me. I use it with my Macbook Pro and had to buy a display port from Amazon. All text, spreadsheets, etc. are crisp and I can open up multiple windows at once, which makes it so much easier to teach students via Zoom. It's the best!
I have had no issues with this monitor. I have a Surface book 2 and connect to the monitor with a USB C hub and a display port cable. works great.

one_review_title: Samsung is all I have to say
one_review_text: Fantastic monitor 4K uhf awesome picture for gaming as well
Beautiful display. 4k looks amazing! Freesync really helps with screen tearing.
The display is awesome and easy to use but I am having trouble getting the sound to come out of it. I assume it's a cable issue? or that my graphics card is custom. I will have to figure that out.
The device has great resolution, I watch netflix and hulu on this screen and it's very nice! No problems at all.
Excellent. Only missing speakers. Giving HDMI connection sound would be a plus.
I really like the picture very sharp. The stand is tri pointed so the back points too far to the rear. I wish you could tilt or raise and lower the frame. Overall it is nice.
Really great monitor amazing image truly worth the money.
This is my first 4k monitor and I must saw it is spectacular! Very clear image, great colors. I use it mostly for video editing.
It is a superb display for the price. I dont need dual setup anymore with this monitor.
I think this was a great value for the size of screen and being 4K. The resolution is great. Not as good as my iMac but it works well as a second monitor.

Just to start with, I got this to replace my UL650W LG, because samsung released an IPS 4milisecond monitor. To my belief I went ahead and rushed for this monitor thinking itll have vibrant colors and great contrast. While the monitor is bright even for 300nits, the contrast on the other hand is great but its to great. How you may ask ? The black levels are extremely dark that you'll want to put the HDMI blk level to normal but in doing so you'll lose bright colors that it offers. You can go for the game mode option but that just saturates the colors to much and changes the greyscale everytime you move your camera angle when playing a game, for instance it occurred while playing ghost on the ps4 pro.  

For those you that want a 4K monitoe  I suggest you go for LG for the IPS panel thats always in the ranks of color accuracy and customizable options especially with blk. Equalizer and color options that let you chose how you may want your colors to look at a saturated angle of your choosing.
It's a great monitor that came with an HDMI cord. I'm glad I can finally work on my projects on a bigger screen.

one_review_title: A very nice monitor and excellent value!
one_review_text: I purchased this monitor for use with my 2016 MacBook Pro and have been delighted ever since. I will say that on occasion when I plug the HDMI to USB-C cable into my Mac, I see a green screen, but it's not a problem. I just unplug it and plug it back in and it works like a charm. I know some people will get irritated by this, but there are bigger things to worry about. The display is beautiful and I now I can watch movies while doing work!

Easy to set up.
Sharp image. 
Type settings are crisp.
I own an LG Oled a d a tcl 7 series.. Both with great picture so in comparison this one gets the job done be the matte finish on the display robs quality.

Got this monitor because of the price in comparison to its counterparts. PS4 pro runs smooth at max 60hz, hdr is recognized, colors pop out and the menu is easy to use with the joystick located in the bottom center. Only trying is that it’s a bit wobbly at times, then again I’m playing games and can maybe shake the desk a bit.....not a big deal really.

Good color is great. Sound is ok
Good price will recommend

I recently purchased a Mac mini (latest version) and then purchased a Samsung 1080p monitor to accompany it.  The monitor wasn't bad but text and other things were not clear so I decided to upgrade to a 4K monitor.  I was happy with the Samsung brand so I snatched this one up before it went out of stock.  This monitor is AMAZING.  Crisp, clear text and the monitor tilts!  I am extremely happy that I picked this one over the other option that was in stock which was a LG 4K monitor in white.  I wanted something sleek to match my space gray Mac mini, keyboard mouse and speakers.  Really a terrific choice!
Wanted a 4K monitor for quite awhile. This one has free sync and HDR. Easy to set up and comes with a HDMI cable.
I bought this for my wife’s hone work station for her Mac and the display is stunning
Solid UHD 4K HDR Monitor. The monitor is tilt enabled. It also supports display port cable
Display quality and resolution is great. Easy set up. Now I have 2 monitors for additional viewing area.
Excellent visuals and a multitude of tools to adjust to the user's preference. Well recommended, especially for its price.
Use it for reading architectural plans and screen is crisp making for easy reading
The screen displays the content of the Apple Macbook Pro beautifully. The detail is extraordinary. This is the best display I have ever used.
Decent 4k monitor, control knob is not the most friendly. Stand is large & lacks multi tilt option.
Great tv for a great price, the picture is beautiful.
Get it. Great quality picture for computing.  100% recommend

I purchased this to beef up my home office game during the shelter in place. I already had a slightly older 27" monitor that I used for working from home 1 day per week pre COVID. With working at home 5 days per week now, I needed more screen real estate for project work, remote screen share meetings and video conference meetings. I've connected the Samsung monitor to both MacBook and Windows based machines and the results are top class. In terms of bang for buck, this monitor is the sweet spot. Probably a little more expensive that some monitors, but the extra is worth it. I have also hooked it up to game consoles and the picture is perfect. I would highly recommend this monitor. Looks great too. Very thin edge bezel.

I use this with a Mac MINI (latest model) and the text is sharp and very clear.  I use some infrequent video and that plays really nice as well.  The controls for it is accessible through a single button which is 4 way and press up for action.  Takes only a few minutes to get used to it.  Pressing once does a quick menu mode.  There is an 'eye saver' feature which makes the screen less bright and less white by turning it warmer.  It's great for first thing in the morning or late at night.  

My only real disappoint is that it is in a fixed position with angle.  It cannot be tiled up or down so keep that in mind.  Otherwise this is a great monitor and I am very pleased with it.
Works great while editing high resolution photo's.  Super sharp image detail.

I'm far from an expert on monitors, but this model is serving me quite well as a second screen for my Dell XPS laptop.  It's great for work (Excel, Word, etc.), watching Netflix, and minor gaming (not a hard-core gamer here).  I actually use if connected to two different computers, and don't have an issue switching back and forth (took a little getting used to is all).
I have NT Samsung monitor . Now i buy IPS monitor . For the price . nice display and colors

I bought as an open-box excellent and you literally could not tell it had ever been out of the box.  I use both HDMI inputs to run two different laptops and have no issues.  The extra resolution is great for work where I can now run multiple spreadsheets side by side and still have room to spare.  If you deal with a lot of data at once then the extra resolution is a must-have.  

The joystick/button controller for all of the settings/options takes a little getting used to and you WILL choose something you didn't mean to as some point.  Only a minor complaint though.

The monitor is great; color reproduction & brightness can at times be too much but those are just menu adjustments needed for the monitor.

What really grinds my gears is the VESA support. When combined with the amazonbasics monitor mount, the monitor is essentially impossible to mount (due to the fact that the provided bracket supports 75mm & 100mm on the same bracket). The plastic backing shroud for the monitor was built to be pretty, and it's that (ultimately unnecessary) design that limits the square bracket from attaching.

I had to do damage to the monitor to get it to mount; If I had been prepared, I would have dremmel'ed the plastic shroud of the monitor to allow it to flush-mount.

If your mount bracket to the VESA is 75mm only, you should be fine.

I bought this monitor and almost returned it because it says "tiltable" and after getting it out of the box I thought it wasn't tiltable that is was like a tv stand and didn't move, I read some reviews to see if anyone had the same issue and I read reviews that people said it wasn't tiltable, but it 100% is tiltable you just have to put a little elbow grease into it.

Picked up two of these for a dual monitor setup. The 4K is fantastic and it has HDR. The black levels are great and the viewing angles are very good. This panel is one of the best I've seen. Can't see how anyone would be disappointed with this monitor from Samsung.
Excellent monitor. Good color, UHD res and great size. Wish it had an integrated camera.

one_review_title: Great UHD monitor for our laptop.
one_review_text: We use this monitor as a mobile set up for our laptop. The only thing I wish it had were internal speakers, but aside from that it is a solid monitor capable of vibrant colors and deep blacks. There are better options, but for someone who edits commercial photography and video on the go. This is a great option.

I purchased two of these to extend my laptop to work from home. Very bright and clear, easy on the eyes. One direct from the HDMI on the laptop, the other using the j5create-USB to 4k adapter. At full 4k on both it is a bit of a drag on the PC.
Great monitor and great price. Great way to get into 4k.

The monitor is great. The image quality is perfect for everyday use. If you work with work with multiple applications at the same time, you can have 2 or 3 just on this screen. In my case I have a laptop and I hardly use that screen anymore. This monitor is enough for my needs. Set up was really easy to complete.

Replaced my primary monitor with this and the switch from 1080P to 4K was absolutely amazing. 28 inch screen is the perfect size and mounting up to a vesa arm has made it perfect. HDR mode gets a little dark, so I currently stick to 4K SDR

I specifically got this monitor for gaming with my PS4 and Xbox One X.  I'm actually surprised with how this monitor performs on these platforms.  Although, it's only a 60hz display, you don't really need more for these platforms.  The HDR also performs well also, my games really pop now.  The viewing angles are also much better on this new monitor.

one_review_title: Sharp and clear, great for wfh professionals.
one_review_text: Great monitor for pros especially if you’re reading spreadsheets and other data all day. Nice sharp, clear images with good contrast and clarity for digging through data all day.  I can’t speak to gaming and refresh rates and all that, but it looks good enough to me to watch a movie on if need be.  The menu buttons are clunky if the monitor goes to sleep first, but otherwise I’m very pleased.

Having to work from home I scrambled to find a monitor, and stumbled upon this.  It's exceeded my expectations for a business monitor.  I can't say how it would perform for gaming, but was a great upgrade from my other displays, and working flawlessly so far.

one_review_title: Amazing monitor, just not for professional work.
one_review_text:
The colors and gama are too difficult to work with even with professional calibration. I used a spyder5 from data color to work with it . Ultimately I was unable to create a workable color profile for photo and video editing.  

Outside of that, if you're using this monitor for gaming or just general use, it is incredibly gorgeous and the iPad really shines through... 

I was hoping to find a solid compromise, alas I had to return it for a BenQ.

I've purchased 2 of these monitors for myself and a coworker, and it is generally a nice monitor. Requires displayport cable to display full 4k, otherwise only 1080p with hdmi. Is this true, or am I missing something?

Nice monitor, sturdy stand, my only wish is that for this price it came with a stand that could rotate - so I could rotate it vertical/portrait.

I got this as a replacement for my venerable old Thunderbolt display which needed a new cable.  I am quite happy. The video resolution and quality is superb. (I do  miss the built in FaceTime camera and USB hub of the Thunderbolt display, but that's not what a normal monitor provides.)

one_review_title: Looks great with an even greater price!
one_review_text: I'm seeing monitors for $800 on up with the same dimensions and even own a 2K monitor but this one looks fantastic for only about $350 making me wonder "Are the other monitors a rip off?".  It doesn't have all the ports as my ultrasharp does but is the perfect monitor for my home office as I just needed something with a great image.

one_review_title: A night and day difference in 4K...
one_review_text: I had been using an older Dell 24 inch monitor for nearly a decade and thought it was pretty good...and then I saw the amazing clarity of this Samsung UR55 monitor and was blown away. Totally crisp and clear images that make my aging eyes feel young again.

Bought this monitor for next gen consoles. While not marketed towards gaming, it is a 4K, 60hz, Freesync monitor. Most next gen games will only be 60 fps so this will work just fine. Looks a lot better than the Odyssey G7 that is double the price. Returned that for this. Awesome monitor!

This does what it's supposed to do. Excellent resolution. My only problem was with the lack of understandable operating instructions. I eventually figured it out. The jog button that turns it on an off and  takes you thru the menu is not very accurate. I spent some frustrating time trying to make that work but it seems to be ok now.

Coming from a 22inch 1080  to this 28inch 4K monitor. Had issues at first running that resolution from a 5 year old PC. So we needed an add-in Geforce 730 card for it to run in full 4k. Picture is amazing.

This monitor is great for small screen console gaming. I don’t give this 5 stars for only 2 reasons: It’s only 60hz, but for console games, that is perfect, and there are no speakers on it, but I was able to find a very good sound system for it here at Best Buy as well for only 40 dollars.

Works as expected. Really great panel, for 4k content. Positioning a back plate on the vesa mount is an issue, but you can work around that by either taking the edge off the mount plate by grinding it down or bending it. I bent the edges, and now it mounts fine. No complaints apart from this.
Bought this for a work from home upgrade.  The picture quality is amazing.  Wound up returning it for a 32", though.  The 28" is a good size but 32" is just a little nicer.

one_review_title: Great addition to my home office
one_review_text: I love using this giant screen in my home office. It makes working from home so much more enjoyable and less of a strain on my eyes!

Delivery was fast, and monitor is gorgeous!
Working from home in style now folks, no more cheap screens, only the best quality from Samsung once again.
Great price, great value and you deserve to treat yourself once in awhile. 
Most definitely recommend and will purchase another one for the kids.

I have used this monitor with my work‘s  window laptop and my personal MacBook Pro. 
Works great. I am an older person. I use the monitor to enhance my experience while editing documents (text and image) and reading news sites.
Connected this monitor to HP Laptop - works great! Beautiful colors! My daughter loves it! Her passion is a photography and she really enjoys it!

one_review_title: Great quality at a reasonable price
one_review_text: I had an existing 28" Samsung monitor and wanted to add to two more similar models to have a three monitor setup. While this monitor was a newer model the image quality and color matched the older model, which is exactly what I wanted.
Not bad... it does what it's supposed to do.  Protip: The volume can actually be controlled by moving the 'nub' on the bottom of the monitor left and right without pushing it in.

Great display as an external monitor

Also use it to game using an Xbox one x. Everything looks sharp, colors pop and HDR looks nice
This monitor is the best monitor I have ever purchased. I liked it so much I bought another one. It is great for programming and playing video games.

A solid 4k monitor being used as my primary alongside my gaming monitor. The screen real estate is great and the visuals are sharp and crisp. There is some backlight bleed along the edges, but honestly that is what to expect when purchasing an IPS display. Won't bother returning it for a replacement.

I bought this for a better work from home setup. Ultimately, looking at the monitor gave me a huge headache, the colors were a bit off, and there were weird scaling issues with the program I have to use for my work. I've only had it for less than a week, and now the display won't power on. This is getting returned. I ended up finding a QHD 27" from ViewSonic that is much better for my needs. It has better color fidelity, tilts, height adjusts, no scaling issues , and doesn't give me a giant headache. My experience won't apply to everyone.

The monitor design itself is modern and neutral, it fit well on my small desk. The build quality felt substantial, and the matte display was great for viewing.
This was a great purchase!  Easy to set up and connect, amazing graphics, and I love the size.  Definitely a good buy!
Great monitor. Good quality for the price. But monitor stand is not great you cannot adjust to great angles.
These are great monitors for work. They are crisp and clear. I did have to buy some spacers to allow me to attach them to my monitor arms.

The screen is nice, big, and clean. Exactly what we wanted. I just wish the monitor stand was adjustable; the screen slightly tilts down, but it isn't too much of a problem. Just a minor inconvenience. Other than, great screen. Works perfectly.

Was very let down by how difficult this has been to get this big guy to play nice with my smaller Samsung FHD monitor.  It looks great, but honestly I can't see any advantage with the HDR enabled in Windows, it looks the same on or off.  The problem is that it keeps blinking in and out of HDR mode when there is HDR content in the screen.  Like the windows volume indicator that pops up when you adjust the volume instantly causes both monitors to black out for a second or two.  Using Premier Pro with the HDR enabled is also very buggy and has caused the same blackouts.  Super annoying.  With HDR disabled it seems pretty great so far but I'm not sold.  I think it's going back.  The advertised HDR support I think is just a way to sell it more, but it really makes no difference on or off.

one_review_title: Leaves a lot to be desired
one_review_text:
I had high expectations for this product - first 4K experience, coming from a 1080P Samsung 32" curved monitor. Aesthetically, the monitor looks very nice. 

My main gripe is interacting with the monitor. Firstly, there is one button that controls the power and menu using directional movement. The button does not register well - sometimes if you press the button the monitor does not turn on. Not a good sign for a button that will be used a lot.

Secondly, there is a lot of difficulty switching between inputs, as other reviewers have also mentioned. There is no ability to choose a specific input, so in order to change inputs the monitor will cycle through until it finds a signal. This also means when you turn off one of the inputted devices, once the monitor loses the signal it will cycle through the other inputs. If it does not find one, then it will go into sleep mode. In order to turn it off, you then need to turn it on and then off again. I can't imagine how difficulty there is when choosing inputs for PIP or PBP.

 I don't have the technical expertise to comment on the unit's performance, but the user experience with this monitor is not great. While it bears the Samsung name, this product could be improved on and brought up to the standard that one would expect from Samsung. My return window has expired, so unfortunately I am stuck with this monitor.Read more
The size is perfect as I sit about 3 ft from the screen. I love that I can connect my work laptop and home pc to the monitor, and then easily switch views or use the split screen.

one_review_title: Not great option for Macbook users
one_review_text: The 4K experience was not compatible with our 2019 Macbook and downgraded from 60Hz to 30Hz. May be fine for Windows laptops. However, another physical feature that I did not like was that the screen tilted slightly downwards on the provided stand. There is an option to buy a separate stand to mount this monitor, but didn't think it was worth it to spend more money on a separate stand.

Image is good BUT

If you wall mount, the mounting on back is just for 75. Most wall mounts have 75-100 so ithe bracket wont fit on back. Super weak. You can still put it on but it will be at a slight angle.

Right half of the monitor has a yellowish tint, there's no color adjustment that will get rid of it. I don't like the standard color options either. "Normal" color profile is yellowish. I don't know if I got a lemon or this is common across all Samsung monitors.

one_review_title: Maybe a got a bad one?
one_review_text: Returned  it had black vertical lines on dark colors. Other than that it’s well built. It was stuck at 59 hertz. Maybe I also got a bad one  I don’t know I used display port.

one_review_title: Burn-in and uneven color ruin it for me
one_review_text:
I really wanted to like this monitor. It has great color, and everything is really sharp. However, it seems like Samsung has poor quality control. My first monitor had 3 dead pixels... 3! I returned it, and got another monitor. My current monitor has some terrible lighting unevenness, especially before it warms up, and especially on grey screens, which look horrendous. The bottom right corner is particularly blue, even on black screens, and I can't stop noticing it ever since I received this monitor. 

I thought all this would go away, but it hasn't. My previous Dell monitor never had this problem. I still use it, and find it much easier on the eyes for some odd reason, too, despite the lower resolution. As a Samsung fan, I am disappointed.

one_review_title: Got 2 of These Both had Particles Under Screen
one_review_text: Monitor seemed great, right when I received both I did white screen tests and both had particles/dust under them where I couldn't clean them off.

one_review_title: Monitor is poor quality. Turns off randomly
